statements: UPDATE RetirementAccounts SET contribution = 5000.00 WHERE account_id = 1001;
UPDATE RetirementAccounts SET manager_name = 'John Doe', investment_growth = 2000.00 WHERE account_id = 1002;

UPDATE RetirementAccounts SET investment_growth = 1500.75, manager_name = 'John Doe' WHERE account_name = 'Savings Account'
UPDATE retirement_accounts SET contribution = contribution + 500 WHERE account_id = 12345;
UPDATE retirement_accounts SET withdrawal = 1500, investment_growth = investment_growth * 1.1 WHERE account_id = 54321;
UPDATE retirement_accounts SET investment_growth = 5000.25, contribution = 2000 WHERE account_id = 101;
UPDATE managers SET experience_years = experience_years + 1, department = 'Finance' WHERE manager_id = 201;
UPDATE contributions SET contribution_amount = 500.00 WHERE id = 1;
UPDATE withdrawals SET date_of_withdrawal = '2022-05-28' WHERE account_id = 101;
UPDATE contributions SET contribution_amount = 500.25, date_of_contribution = '2022-09-15' WHERE id = 1;
UPDATE investment_growth SET date_of_growth = '2022-10-01', growth_percentage = 0.05 WHERE id = 3;
UPDATE contribution_table SET amount = 1000.00 WHERE account_id = 123;
UPDATE account_info_table SET balance = 5000.00, client_name = 'John Doe' WHERE account_id = 456;
UPDATE contribution_table SET amount = 1500.00, timestamp = '2021-09-15 10:30:00' WHERE account_id = 101;
UPDATE account_info_table SET client_name = 'John Doe', balance = 5000.00 WHERE account_id = 201;
UPDATE RetirementAccounts SET balance = 15000.00 WHERE account_id = 101;
UPDATE InvestmentGrowth SET growth_rate = 7.5 WHERE account_id = 201;
UPDATE RetirementAccounts SET balance = balance - 5000, created_date = '2022-09-15' WHERE account_id = 12345;
UPDATE Contributions SET amount = amount + 1000 WHERE contribution_id = 67890;
